question: 活用
sourceMnemonic:
What do you <kanji>use</kanji> to show that a word is <kanji>lively</kanji>? <vocabulary>Conjugation</vocabulary>! Lively things are happening, so you have to conjugate your words to match. 

It also has another meaning. When you want to actually use something lively you are making <vocabulary>practical use</vocabulary> of it. I mean, you're using it, after all. So as long as you aren't pretending to use it, it's probably practical.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
